caption: Ive been visiting Otello for years! Food is excellent... if you order the crabmeat linguine your belly will thanks you! Portions are usually enough to share especially for a light lunch. The restaurant is nice and quaint the owner is often walking through greeting and and thanking patrons. Staff is attentive and some have been there since I started coming  back in 2010 or 2011.
Great food. Very friendly server and manager.
Otello offers great food in generous portions in a cute, tucked away setting. Definitely a relief from the hustle and bustle outside and a great place for a romantic dinner.
My all time favorite Italian Restaurant of all time.  Love the food, atmosphere and watching the family interact is incredible.  Best food ever

My favourite Italian place in DC. The manager Carlos embodies the best of restaurant hospitality in town. The food is fabulous, especially the linguini with crab meat. Traditional style of casa de la mamma, Italian music and all. House chianti is the best. Editing the review now to reflect another pleasant surprise. I returned for another round of the linguini, and ordered it to go. When I arrived at my office, I saw the attention to detail and perfect care of the staff at the Otello for making sure I had all I needed to best enjoy a warm meal despite the cold harsh winds outside. They wrapped the container with an extra protection, and even remembered the cheese as in my previous order. Thank you, Otello guys!
Great Italian food!
Good food good service! Would rate higher if the carpets were cleaner but we will be back.
Delicious, large portions, were happy to accommodate kids with half portions and cushion orders, seems like a good place for dates as well as families.
Was most awesome experience!
Tastey food. It's Italian. They have lots of pasta!
Food was delicious. Prices were more expensive than shown in the menu pictures online though.

I was walking past site seeing and i visited 2 stores beside this resturant just looking new to the area , so i started getting tired and stopped in frount of this resturant and a man with a red car that was fixing his car in frount of the building started disrespectfuly walking up to me puting his hand in my face (yelling)telling me to move from in frount of his business ... Not knowing if i was walking into the resturant next, he just started harrasing me as if he wasnt making his resturant a mechanic shop ! Very rude !

Great food! Just try to go for lunch, as the prices were better. It is a bit pricey for dinner. The wine is mostly by the bottle, but they have one white and one red by glass. The pour is small. So either buy a bottle or don't get any. Too expensive. The owner is super nice and will greet every patron. It feels like you are at a neighborhood business. 😃
Never have I had better Italian in the States. What a gem.

(Translated by Google) A small "rustic" restaurant with nice staff. The food (3x pasta) was delicious and especially the sauces have spoken for the location. The selection is clear and fits the ambience. The decoration is well chosen, if a bit cheesy in some places. Price but unfortunately again a bit more expensive than usual. The staff is attentive, if a bit intrusive, so you were asked at the food ten times, if everything was ok. The cleanliness is not 100%, so it could be better in some places, but only indoors, cutlery and dishes were clean. In the whole very delicious and nice atmosphere.  (Original) Ein kleines "uriges" Lokal mit nettem Personal. Das Essen (3x Pasta) war sehr lecker und vor allem die Saucen haben für die Lokalität gesprochen. Die Auswahl ist übersichtlich und passt zum Ambiente. Die Deko ist gut gewählt, wenn auch an einigen Stellen etwas kitschig. Preislich aber leider auch wieder etwas teurer als gewohnt. Das Personal ist aufmerksam, wenn auch etwas aufdringlich, so wurde man beim essen an die 10 mal gefragt, ob denn alles ok sei. Die Sauberkeit ist nicht 100%ig, so könnte es an einigen Stellen doch besser sein, aber nur im Innenbereich, Besteck und Geschirr waren sauber. Im Gesamten sehr lecker und schöne Atmosphäre.
Bad food, service, and hidden prices. Skip

The food is quite tasty. The dishes we had were very heavy, but if you like that it's a great place. The real charm and appeal, though, is how much it feels like you've left DC as soon as you walk in. It's a cozy, friendly Italian restaurant that could be in any sleepy town. You can't even hear the street.

Classic italian-american food near Dupont circle. Mildly cheesy in an appealing, checked table cloth kind of way. Solid service for decent prices. Dinner seems to pick up closer to 7, we came at 630 and there was only one other table. They do have house reds and white by the glass though I don't think they're on the menu. The food was good, sauced fairly heavily in a more American style. I got a crab meat and cream pasta, my fiancee got a sausage pasta I can't remember the proper name for and both tasted good and came pretty quickly. The fried mozzarella appetizer was a high light, as well as a good tiramisu that skimped on super strong Expresso flavor but did have a properly heavy mascarpone.

Was at  Otello 7-9-19 and was seriously disappointed. Seafood pasta which had shrimp, scallop, mussels, and calmari contaied numerous mussel shells with undersized or non-existent mussells and the toughest, rubbery, tasteless calmari imaginable! It's as though the chef had overcooked a batch of calamari and had having nothing to do with it- dumped it into the dish along with a subpar batch of mussells. Although the ambience and service was excellent Otello should be ashamed tp plate let alone charge for such inferior products and cooking...next time just serve an old bicycle tire and empty sea shells!!!
Very delicious and rich with generous portions
Overcooked pasta which is one of the worst think you can review of a supposedly Italian restaurant

I just had some of the best lasagna I have ever had.  It is a family-run Italian restaurant in the Golden Triangle, and the owner is a friendly, honest-to-god, Italian grampa.  He came to our table to make sure we were enjoying our meal, and nearly killed himself running to the exit when we left to shake our hands and thank us for coming.  Food came out fast and portions were appropriate. Service was great, as well. Grazie!  5/5.  WILL be back!

I've gone here for the last 3 years. The staff is always so accommodating and amazing. The food came out pretty fast this last time I attended. The place has a cute authentic feel to it with a great manager and menu. Highly recommend for italian food
Great wait staff serving wonderful Italian dishes. Have come here for years!

We were looking for a neighborhood gem and found it.  Authentic Italian and excellent.  I had linguini fruti di mare in a light tomato sauce.  My wife had cheese ravioli in tomato and basil sauce.  Both were perfect.  It’s a cozy place that feels like it’s been transplanted right from Southern Italy.  Service was very good and made us feel very welcome.  So, we loved it.
Great food and service
Very good food, service, and atmosphere.  Spaghetti  was one of the best.
Everything was delicious. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. :)
The mussels in tomato sos were as good as it gets

Tired old Italian in a city that’s long since moved past it. The smell of mothballs from the blue-haired clientele hits you the moment you walk in the door. I got the sense that everything I ate, from the fried zucchini to the oddly stuffed “gnocchi” (tough ravioli, actually) came straight from the frozen foods section at Costco. There are so many better options for Italian in this neighborhood, let alone the rest of the city.
Great food and service
Lovely Italian cantina love the food and atmospheric.
Very nice small quiet Italian restaurant.  The three of us all had excellent food. Reminds me of some of the small places we ate at in Italy.
the BEST Italian restaurant on the east coast hands down. my family and I have been going here for 25 years now. amazing food, service and staff. ask for roberto!
Very friendly and accommodating staff! Great food! Great dessert (recommend tarrimisu or cheesecake)  If I didn't live in NY, I'd come here all the time for dinner
Food was amazing everything can't wait to try the dessert next!
Authentic Italian restaurant even manager/owner seems to be speaking Italian with servers. Dinner items are little expensive though we loved the taste and the portion is good
Nice place. Excellent small Italian  place. Good fast service.
Very nice restaurant. Excellent attention by the servers and owner himself. Food was very tasty and fresh. Centrally located.
Wonderful food
Delicious food, try the fried zuccini starter and alfredo pasta is AMAZING , service is excellent also 😍❤️
Traditional family run Italian restaurant
Interesting place. Incredible location. The food was a tad Salty and I S*** my brains out for two days after eating there. Great ambiance; very accommodating staff.
My favorite Italian restaurant in DC. Small, family feel, excellent food, attentive staff. They have a full bar too so you can get pretty much whatever you want to drink.

One of the best Italian restaurants! The staff is friendly and very accommodating. They make sure that you have a good time especially when its not too crowded. Food is just absolutely delicious and the portions are large. Their cannolis are out of this world - the best. Its our go-to restaurant to celebrate special occasions.
Food was great with great service
Excellent food, great service, and a delightful ambiance. Am glad we stopped in to celebrate my mom's birthday.
I love this place! The food is amazing and so is the service.

If you're looking for old school Italian, it's tough to find anywhere else that does it as well as Otello. Make sure you check out the specials board as everything on it is the freshest, but you can't go wrong with their main menu anyway (the stuffed gnocchi are fantastic). This place is the epitome of simple components done to the highest quality; check it out.
Excellent food 👌
The Italian flavor was delicious and very wonderful.
Great food and service and it family friendly
Very charming staff, large portions, cosy atmosphere. I plan on returning.

We got at the restaurant 8:30PM and the place supposed to close at 10PM. The host said they were closing because “today was a bad day” but we could take a pasta and leave in 30 minutes, so we decided to bet because the reviews were very good. One minute after we sat the waiter wanted take our orders and we had to decide under pressure and hurry. It was ok... until we hear a man on the back (probably the owner or a manager) screaming so loud a few Italian bad words in our direction. We are Portuguese native speakers and “son of a b...” is pretty universal among Latin languages. They are insulting their customers in Italian!!! We decided to leave immediately and we DON’T RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL unless you want learn some bad Italian words! Total insolence, lousy treatment!
Just as I remembered it 20+ years ago. Classic food and service stands the test of time.

One of the best meals I’ve had in a while! The service was spectacular and our food was out in minutes. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an authenic Italian meal. Can’t wait to go back next time we’re in D.C.

We really enjoyed our food but we felt it was very pricey for what we had (just a main course for 4 people ).   The bill came to $170.  The service was excellent and no other complaints. Maybe it's just a lot more expensive in Washington?
The food was really meh. The service was alright. Ut definitely got the feeling that I was being rushed out.
Food was good. Staff not so friendly.
The food and the service we're both excellent.  I especially appreciated that they happily accommodated my 4-year-old's request for pasta with tomato sauce, even though it wasn't on the menu.

My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our dinner here. The staff was attentive and friendly, and the food was delicious. The portions were generous at a reasonable price. Atmosphere was quaint and charming.
Very authentic Italian - everything, from the olive oil and the pasta. This is not American Italian, this is  true Italian. Fantastic service and ambiance. Highly recommend!
Fantastic service and delicious food! Highly recommend the pastas & mussels.
Everything about Otello was amazing! Our server had a great personality and made our visit one we will never forget! The best Italian food I have ever had! Authentic Sicilian food!!
Food was pretty bad, as was the service. Waiter wrote in extra for a tip.
Incredible food.  Authentic setting.  Highly recommend!

ABSOLUTE A MUST, completely recommend, & plan on stopping again! Place smelled a little musty, and could use some decor upgrades (they have garlic as decor?) BUT the owner was the host, very attentive. We were seated immediately, waited on immediately (there were 2, also very attentive waiters). The meal was AMAZING- warm, thoroughly cooked, delicious, moist, the cuts of sausage I had in my dish were evenly cut. For two pasta dishes, one was the Sausage penne, the other the seafood pasta- it was $53. Amazingly priced, great service, even gave a free taste test of the dessert wine (they carded, I didn't get any bc I'm 20- but my boyfriend, who is 23, said it was amazing). ---I wish to add a photo of my dish, but I cannot find how to input it. Either way, the dish was beautifully displayed, and was just top-tier.
Great food and great service

I LOVED this restaurant! The food was incredible. We had bruschettas, pasta, white pizza, rice balls, etc. Everything tasted great. The ambiance in the restaurant is great. Very cool decor and an AMAZING play list. The only small complaint I have is that it was a little crowded by the door, but that wasn't such a big deal. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. Make sure to make a reservation!

Bland, oily and ridiculously expensive.  First and last time here.  Maybe we just ordered incorrectly.  Seafood tasted frozen and chicken parmigiana was swimming in oil.  Don't waste your money on this restaurant.
Amazing food, atmosphere was beautiful, waiter we're very nice..if in area again will definitely try again
Sauces are terrific.
Bread was cold. Service was great. Rigatoni dish was bland but not unenjoyable. For a special dish, I expected a little more for my $25.
Always great food-and they will take special orders too!! Live this neighborhood gem.
Food was outstanding. Nice friendly staff. Will definitely go there  again
Amazing food, great friendly service. Would recommend this to anyone that wants authentic Italian food in a great atmosphere.
Ownercame.to our table. Made sure we were enjoying ourselves.  It was wonder experience .

Great food and great service! We were greeted with open arms ... literally. The gentleman (assuming he was the owner) was so kind, treated us like we had been coming there for years ... felt like it too. A true gem. Grazie mille!
This is a gem! Excellent service and food. Nice wine list. Cozy Dupont Circle restaurant with old fashioned red & white checked table cloths. Loved it.
One of my favorite restaurants.  The food is spot on and the staff are fantastic! Been going to Otello for years
I've been coming to Otello's for over 20 years and I've never been disappointed. My birthday dinner was awesome!!!
Best Italian in DC!  Disclaimer: I’ve only had Italian at once place in DC, Otello’s!
Great under the radar spot for good Italian food and great service.
Great food experience and staff
Horrible food and horrible prices. If people think this is good food, I feel bad for you.
This is a great Italian restaurant
Enjoyable ambiance.  Great food, fun experience. The entire crew hussles to serve you.

My dish was very average and did not leave a lasting impression.  The price point of the menu is where this restaurant excels.  Overall I am glad I dropped in, but will not be looking to make a second appearance soon.
The atmosphere and food are very authentically Italian!
Best Italian food in DMV area

We dropped in to fulfill a pasta craving and we're rewarded with two delicious plates - one mushroom pasta and one seafood fettuccine. Excellent ambiance and delightful service (and as a nice perk, the food came super quick). Highly recommend this gem!

The waiter we had was the rudest I have ever encountered. He refused to let us order an appetizer without ordering entrees at the same time, ordered us around like it was a privilege for us to dine at the restaurant, and was overall just extremely rude with his comments and demeanor. I hope everyone reading this decides to skip this place, I know I will never, never, never be back.

Pastas were good, but not great for an Italian place. Cannoli was too sweet - even for a sweets lover. Service was on top of their game and covered the entree when my friend stepped out to take a call to keep it hot.

By far, this was an excellent  restaurant. The service was impeccable. The ambiance was great; very warm and charming. The food was very tasty and well prepared. The wine was great. This is a must for great Italian food.

We had dinner here tonight after seeing all the positive reviews, and I'm so glad we did. Lovely atmosphere, staff were really responsive and friendly, food came out quickly and was delicious! Would highly recommend! :)
Very cozy casual Italian dining restaurant with great food and service. My wife and I both had veal dishes which were excellent! Can't wait to go back.
One of my favorite Washington restaurants. Great food. Cozy atmosphere. Very friendly owner and staff.
Quiet, peaceful ambience, which is a nice change of pace from the city. Food was very good but prices are a little high. Overall, great experience.
The real deal italian food. Excellent service.
I love the food and the chef's specials are amazing especially the lobster ravioli I've never had anything so good!  If you are near try it you'll never stop going!
Good taste of the plates and very big portions.
Great intimate setting and AMAZING food!
Small, cozy place. The service was great and the food was even better.

This place was awesome! Customer service was great, the manager was super nice and professional. The food was awesome and more than enough to eat. Food came fast, hot, they were ready to take our order. I would definitely recommend it and would also come back too!
We were  celebrating after GWU commencement.  They got us right in. Nice restaurant, great food, and friendly staff.
Really good food, even went out of their way to make chocolate milk for my niece when they didn't have any.
Excellent food , fast and courteous service
Food was ok but we were charged 15 % more than the menu price. Beware!
Been a couple times and has a mixed experience. Food is fine and service can be friendly or terse, depending on who knows what. Overall meh.

While visiting DC my friend and I had dinner here. The atmosphere was very cozy and quiet. The food was amazingly authentic and the service was second to none. It was quite busy and the only table available was for two but located directly inside the front door. We were seated there only momentarily when our waiter moved us to a much better table near a window. This restaurant is an amazing date night spot!
Wonderful homemade pasta! Loved our dinner tonight!
Very expensive and not that high class
Quaint and quiet setting. Delicious authentic Italian food. Attentive waitstaff. What more could you want?
Amazing food and service!
Traditional.
Its ok.  Setting was fine.  Nothing special.  Food was ok.  all in all, it was fine.

Classic Italian fare with a minimum of frills. This place has been here forever, I used to go back in the 90s. Red checkered tablecloth and a menu of Italian favorites. Nice location in Dupont Circle and a friendly wait staff. My wife had the tortellini with cream sauce which was good if a little heavy. My veal was tender and tasty.
Some of the worst italian food I've ever eaten.  Overcooked pastas, rubbery veal and lousy bread.  Save the trip, find another restaurant - it was that bad!
Great for a date night. Food was good, and so was the atmosphere.
I come here quite often and I can honestly say it's by far the best Italian Restaurant! They never disappoint me whenever I come. Food is always tasty and Service is always great !
The food was very good and tasty.   The place is not well taken care of  ...
The food was alright. Nothing serious to complain about, but nothing to write home about either. The meat-filled gnocchi didn't taste very gnocchi-like, which was disappointing.

The food was AMAZING. Both my husband and I LOVED our meals. I ordered spaghetti and wish I would have ordered a whole extra portion so I could have had it all over again. It is rare to order spaghetti and LOOOOOVE it, but it was incredible. Seriously. This place is a must.
Great portions of delicious food served in a relaxing atmosphere
Go here all the time for lunch. Too little known, but great food, and perfect for a power-lunch.  Excellent pastas, recommend the off-menu penne puttanesca, as well as the Scarola Stufata appetizer.
Decent place. Relatively limited options, but reasonable prices. You can definitely do better, but it isn't terrible.
Had chicken alfredo pasta. It was good, but a bit soupy for my liking.
I ordered the tortalinicrema. It was awesome. Rich, creamy, tasty, well cooked al dente. The atmosphere was quiet and calm. I will be back

As we had never been to dc before I found this online and wow we got lucky food was great prices was about 15 for good side pasta dish and the people where so friendly and my family just loves this place!
Delicious food served by an attentive staff in a comforting atmosphere.

The waiters STEAL, The food was meh but for 10$ for a basic Caesar salad and the  seafood "special" for 28$ I have had WAY better. Hell Carmines doesn't charge this much for what you get. The waiter up sold me and when I gave him a short tip (which turned out to be a good thing.) They charged my card 6 EXTRA dollars. So I had to go all the way up and get my money. The sad part is , the waiter ( instead of apologizing) to me said  "Just so you know, we don't get paid by the hour, we get paid by our tips".....umm I DON'T CARE you don't steal from customers. And with other reviews this is not uncommon. AVOID THIS PLACE you will not miss a thing. I went by myself as I love trying out new restaurants but be warned.

Fully authentic Italian selection.  THE BEST pasta recipes in town. I find myself extremely picky when it comes to Italian food and this place blew me Away. Prices are very nice especially for the quality of food and service . This place should charge a fortune . I will defiantly stop here on my next trip to Washington dc.
Amazing Food Amazing Staff Amazing Service. Authentic Italian Food. Blown Away.

Nice warm friendly casual with good service multi server bus boy and attentive waiters. Real good hearty pasta dishes ate past primavera yum and fried mozzarella . Also daily specials seafood sounded good but didn't try them other looked pleased. Signed tourist from L A. (Bathroom down scary hallway basement :)

Great hidden Italian Restaurant that we tried after looking for something kid-friendly, affordable, and within walking distance. Place has been around for over 30 years. Roberto our waiter was excellent! Friendly staff, nice atmosphere and even better food. Wine selection was limited but overall we were very pleased and will be coming back/recommending in the future!
Amazing Italian cooking in a cozy atmosphere! Highly recommend the Alfredo sauce!

My first time in DC and my girlfriend and I just by chance decided to eat here. The food was amazing only to be topped by the  wonderful service. I loved the atmosphere and the waiting staff made the authentic Italian experience even better! I would highly recommend it to anyone!!!!! 10/10

Most importantly, the food was flavorless. We chose this restaurant for pre Marine Corps Marathon carb loading because the reviews were so good. They only offer three wines by the glass which are listed quickly when asked. I has the Chianti and it was flat. Clearly trying to force you to a bottle purchase.  We started with the the bruschetta which was clumsily prepared and lacking. Tomatoes were mealy and the bread was overly doughy. The cheese was the highlight of the night. I had one of the specials, seafood linguine with scallpps, shrimp, mussels and squid in tomato sauce. Almost all of the seafood was overcooked and chewy. The pasta tasted like it had been sitting in water all night. Tomato sauce was thin and watery. My husband had the penne with sausage and while the sausage tasted good  he had the same complaints about the pasta and sauce. It then took fifteen minutes to get our check. We left highly disappointed.

Very, very good food. Was a bit chaotic inside and took some time to get the check but the staff was nice. We had capellini and gnocchi for dinner and prosciutto and melon as an app. Delicious. I'm Italian, so I'm picky, and the food was perfect.

I've been dining here for almost 14 years.  It is the BEST italian food you can get in the DC area hands down!!!!!  The crab linguine is sooooo good.  I get the food to go to to take home with me to Maryland.  Try it you won't be disapointed.
A different restaurant was recommended to us and billed as 'the best Italian in D.C.' WRONG! Otello is THE BEST ITALIAN in D.C.!!! Don't try anywhere else! Absolutely AWESOME!!!

Great, absolutely great chicken parmesan.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly. They let me substitute spinach in place of the pasta; it was tender and fluffy and great. I get here because of business about once a year, I will definitely be back.
Good food and service. Decor could use updating but overall good experience.
Just amaznig!
Great food especially the eggplant parm. Great service. Dined alone. Always been consistent in quality. I go back every time ive  been in dc. Give it a go!
Homey and authentic down to the checkered tablecloths and the cold antipasto bar. Calamari comes with a spicy marinara. Grouper did as well
